headline: Why Do People Believe In Hell?
abstract: The idea of eternal damnation is neither biblically, philosophically nor morally justified. But for many it retains a psychological allure.
lead_paragraph: Once the faith of his youth had faded into the serene agnosticism of his mature years, Charles Darwin found himself amazed that anyone could even wish Christianity to be true. Not, that is, the kindlier bits — “Love thy neighbor” and whatnot — but rather the notion that unbelievers (including relatives and friends) might be tormented in hell forever.
